read a vector spatial file to R

function for easily opening a ESRI shapefile (or other OGR compatible vector file) by simply specifying its filename

read_vect(shp_file, as_sp = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

shp_file

character Filename of ESRI shapefile to be opened
as_sp

logical If TRUE, the opened object is automatically converted to sp format. Otherwise, an sf object is returned. Default: FALSE
...

other arguments to be passed tosf::st_read

Value

sf or sp object (depending on as_sp setting)

Details

simple wrapper around sf::read_sf, with some checks on inputs and possibility of automatic re-casting to *sp objects

See also

read_sf

Examples

library(sprawl.data)
# open a shapefile as a `sf` object
 shp_file = system.file("extdata","lc_polys.shp", package = "sprawl.data")
 read_vect(shp_file)
#> Simple feature collection with 13 features and 4 fields
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 120.1778 ymin: 15.15353 xmax: 121.3394 ymax: 16.09343
#> epsg (SRID):    4326
#> proj4string:    +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs
#> # A tibble: 13 x 5
#>       id       lc_type category sup_catego          geometry
#>    <dbl>         <chr>    <chr>      <chr> <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  1     1      forest_1   Forest Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  2     2      forest_2   Forest Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  3     3       urban_1    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  4     4    cropland_1 Cropland Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  5     5    cropland_2 Cropland Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  6     6      forest_3   Forest Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  7     7    reiver_bed    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  8     8    cropland_3 Cropland Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#>  9     9  urban_2_part    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#> 10    10 sparsfor_part   Forest Vegetation <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#> 11    11         water    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#> 12    12    small_feat    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>
#> 13    13      out_feat    Other      Other <S3: sfc_POLYGON>

# open a shapefile as a `sp` object
 shp_file = system.file("extdata","lc_polys.shp", package = "sprawl.data")
 read_vect(shp_file, as_sp = TRUE)
#> class       : SpatialPolygonsDataFrame 
#> features    : 13 
#> extent      : 120.1778, 121.3394, 15.15353, 16.09343  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0 
#> variables   : 4
#> names       : id,    lc_type, category, sup_catego 
#> min values  :  1, cropland_1, Cropland,      Other 
#> max values  : 13,      water,    Other, Vegetation
